title: A2289 820-01987-A 5v .31ma
message:
No sign of spillage on the board that I can see.
It draws 5v .31ma .
PPBUS_g3h is 1v diode reading .385. I have tried dfu mode but host Mac can not see it. I tried removing U4770 and reprogramming it but still same.
I cannot find any shorts on the board.

title: A2289 820-01987-A 5v .31ma
message:
You can't do anything until get PPBUS_G3H at least.

Do you get 5V at U7000?
If yes, post its basic voltages; P_IN, AUX_DET, VDDA/P.

title: A2289 820-01987-A 5v .31ma
message: U7000 R7021 and R7022 were both high 87k and small  discoloration on U7000 so changed both resistors and now getting 20v 0.27v, PPbus_G3h is now 11.2v . I can now get it into dfu mode but it keeps erroring out on host machine. The host is running Big Sur, not sure what the faulty one was running.

title: A2289 820-01987-A 5v .31ma
message: How does it ready when you put it in DFU mode and choose recover? Do you hav a stable internet connection?

title: A2289 820-01987-A 5v .31ma
message: Yes internet is stable. I have tried recover and also revive but errors out on both. Also it shows the recovery screen as in pic when mac is plugged in without pressing any buttons but if you hold power for a few mins the hold all 4 buttons it says DFu not recovery but still the same outcome. Also the target mac screen shows logo with progress bar fully across then disappears then the error in pic shows on host machine.

title: A2289 820-01987-A 5v .31ma
message: Try DFU mode disconnecting battery and charger.

title: A2289 820-01987-A 5v .31ma
message: Do you mean with battery disconnected? if so then yes I have tried that a few times, same error.

title: A2289 820-01987-A 5v .31ma
message:
And charger disconnected also.
5V from AC2 machine is good enough...

title: A2289 820-01987-A 5v .31ma
message: Is there a special way to do that as I cannot get the host to see the mac with charger and battery disconnected?.

title: A2289 820-01987-A 5v .31ma
message: Use SE032 to force DFU mode.

title: A2289 820-01987-A 5v .31ma
message: What is the procedure to do this ? Do I inject voltage?

title: A2289 820-01987-A 5v .31ma
message:
Temporar contact on SE032 pads, to force DFU; without charger, nor battery connected.
The 5V from the other machine (with AC2), will power the board.

title: A2289 820-01987-A 5v .31ma
message:
Hi thanks for the info but still the same. It just says "The system cannot be restored on this device" and also "Gave up waiting for the device to transition from DFU state to Dfu state".  I have tried several different macs, Os and cables.

I have a t2 rom programmer is there any use in flashing U4700? if so any idea where I can find clean dump for this chip.

Thanks

title: A2289 820-01987-A 5v .31ma
message:
Do you mean U4770?
Some people claim on Internet to revived dead boards reflashing it; no mention about this particular board.

I remember when I flashed SoC ROM between two 01521 and I lost even 20V on USB-C input.
Do not trust all you read on Internet...

title: A2289 820-01987-A 5v .31ma
message: Yes that is correct U4770. I was going to look for clean dump for this board to try but can only find the ones that come with the t203 programmer but Im not sure if these are clean or modified dumps.

title: A2289 820-01987-A 5v .31ma
message:
What clean means?
That is not BIOS with ME region...

title: A2289 820-01987-A 5v .31ma
message: I mean the dumps you get with the t203 are modified are they not?

title: A2289 820-01987-A 5v .31ma
message:
No idea.
As I said, read dump from 01521 didn't work for me in other 01521 board.

title: A2289 820-01987-A 5v .31ma
message: Is there anything else I could look at regarding signals voltages ect ?

title: A2289 820-01987-A 5v .31ma
message: If cannot complete DFU not much to do...
